column4: ok, i have a network, is there a way to increase the speed of a download, or to dedicate a certain amount of bandwidth to a download?
priority for that type of thing is sometimes done in your router.. for large legal downloads sometimes torrents help alot

well, i am trying to download frostwire, and normally my rate is up around 700-800kb or so, i am pulling excellent speed on the downside right now, 6m, but trying to download that my rate is like under 10k, i dont know whats up, its taking for ever to download a 6.3mb file
has to do with the servers you're connected to.. why frostwire? you have a torrent app built in that's pretty good
not very familiar with it, do u recommend what comes installed or is there a better one out there?
nope maverick, but still running gnome
transmission is the default torrent program that's installed.. I've never really had an issue with it.

k, i will check that out, any other idea with the download issue, while that is my current problem, i have run into it before and never really understood why i have a 6m downstream but cant actually download at that, you say it should be setting in router?
you could be choked by your isp.. lots of them don't like torrents
well, this isnt a torrent, just a regular old download through a browser
then it's server related.. maybe someone else on your LAN is playing xbox, streaming video,music etc ??
nah, cant be that, no one else on here but me, and i ran speedtest, shouldnt be any traffic issues, stats look real good, low ping times and pullin about 6m down
then it has to be the server you're connected to for the download..
k, thats cool, i have one more question for you if you dont mind
actually, nevermind, i appreciate the help, i can probably find some info for this, thanks :)
